info.title: Payment Service
info.description:
**Download OpenAPI specification**: [Download](/bundled.json)

# Introduction

The Dojo API is RESTful. It returns HTTP response codes to indicate errors. It also
accepts and returns JSON in the HTTP body.

## Base URLs

Use the following base URL when making requests to the API:  https://api.dojo.tech/

## Looking for no-code solutions?

Try one of our [pre-builded solutions](../docs/plugins/) for your site.

# Authentication

The Dojo API uses [Basic HTTP auth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_access_authentication). To generate your API keys, send a request to our [support team](https://support.dojo.tech/hc/en-gb/requests/new).
Secret keys for the test environment have the prefix `sk_sandbox_` and for production have the prefix `sk_prod_`.

You must include your secret API key in the header of all requests, for example:

```curl
curl
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --header 'Authorization: Basic sk_prod_your_key' \
...
    
```

API requests without authentication will fail.

<SecurityDefinitions />

# HTTP Responses

The API returns HTTP responses on each request to indicate the success or otherwise of API requests. The various HTTP status codes we might return are listed below.

| Code  | Title | Description |
|-----|-----|-----|
|`200`|`OK`| The request was successful. |
|`400`|`Bad Request`| Bad request, probably due to a syntax error. |
|`401`|`Unauthorized`| Authentication required. |
|`402`|`Request Failed`| Over plan quota on this endpoint. |
|`404`|`Not Found`| The resource doesn't exist. |
|`405`|`Method Not Allowed`| The used request method isn't supported by that resource, for example using a POST on a resource that requires a GET.
|`409`|`Conflict`| The request couldn't be completed because it conflicted with another request or the server's configuration. |
|`50X`|`Internal Server Error`| An error occurred with our API.|

# Errors

Dojo follows the error response format proposed in [RFC 7807](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7807) also known as Problem Details for HTTP APIs. All errors are returned in the form of JSON.

## Error Schema

In case of an error, the response object contains the following fields:

| Field | Type|  Description |
|-----|-----|-----|
|`errors`|`object`| A human-readable explanation of errors.|
|`type`|`string`| A URI reference [RFC 3986](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3986) that identifies the problem type.|
|`title`|`string`| A short, human-readable summary of the error. |
|`status`|`integer`| The [HTTP status code](#section/HTTP-Responses). |
|`traceId`|`string`| The unique identifier of the failing request.|
|`detail`|`string`| A human-readable message giving more details about the error. Not always present.|

The following example shows a possible error response:

```json
{
    "errors": {
        "Reference": [
            "The Reference field is required."
        ]
    },
    "type": "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.5.1",
    "title": "One or more validation errors occurred.",
    "status": 400,
    "traceId": "00-a405f077df056a498323ffbcec05923f-aa63e6f4dbbc734a-01",
    
}
```

# Versioning

Dojo API uses the YYYY-MM-DD API version-naming scheme. You have to pass the version as the `version` header in all API calls, for example:

``` curl
curl
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --header 'Authorization: Basic sk_prod_your_key' \
  --header 'version: 2022-04-07' \
    
```

When we make [breaking changes](../docs/development-resources/versioning-overview#breaking-changes) to the API, we release new dated versions.

The current version is 2022-04-07.

# Postman collection

You can run the API collection in Postman:

 [![Run in Postman](https://run.pstmn.io/button.svg)](https://god.gw.postman.com/run-collection/16735701-b218f555-a7ad-46c4-8ad8-1f11c0aee443?action=collection%2Ffork&collection-url=entityId%3D16735701-b218f555-a7ad-46c4-8ad8-1f11c0aee443%26entityType%3Dcollection%26workspaceId%3Dfdd152df-0154-428c-aeb4-1b90e46b8523)

tags.name: Payment intents
tags.description:
Allows you to take and manage payments.

**Documentation**: [Payments](../docs/accept-payments/)

tags.name: Refunds
tags.description:
Allows you to manage a refund for payments.

**Documentation**: [Refunds](../docs/manage-payments/cancellation-payments/refund/)

tags.name: Reversal
tags.description:
Allows you to create a reversal for payments.

**Documentation**: [Reversal](../docs/manage-payments/cancellation-payments/reversal/)

tags.name: Captures
tags.description:
Allows you to capture the full payment amount or part of the amount.

**Documentation**: [Captures](../docs/manage-payments/capture/)

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description:
Webhooks notify you when a specific event has occurred. 

**Documentation**: [Webhooks](../docs/development-resources/webhooks/)

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: API version with format yyyy-mm-dd. Current version is 2022–04–07. Today's date will always give you the latest version.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for the payment intent.

get.description: Retrieves the details of a payment intent.

parameters.name: paymentIntentId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the payment intent.

delete.description: Cancels a payment intent. The payment intent can be canceled if it's in the `Created` status. After cancellation, the payment intent will change the status to `Canceled` and any operations on the payment intent will fail with an error.

post.description: Captures a payment intent that has previously been created but not yet refunded or reversed. You can capture the full amount or a partial amount.

post.description:
Retrieves a list of payment intents.
Results are paginated, by default the method returns up to 50 payment intents.

post.description: Changes tips amount for a payment intent. Available if you allowed tips when creating this payment intent.

post.description: Changes the amount for a payment intent. Available if you allowed the amount changes when creating this payment intent.
Sends a receipt to the email addresses you specified.

parameters.description: An optional idempotency key to recognize subsequent retries of the same request. How you generate the idempotency key is up to you. Must be unique for each new refund for the payment intent.

CaptureMode.title: CaptureMode
CaptureMode.description: The type of capture for the payment.

value.description: The amount in the minor unit, for example "100" for 1.00 GBP.

address2.description: Address line 2 (for example, street, apartment, or suite).

city.description: City, town, district, suburb, or village.

locality.description: Locality, can use in addition to city.

TransactionSource.description: `MOTO` if the source of the transaction is mail or phone. Otherwise, this field is null.
TransactionSource.title: TransactionSource

collectionRequired.description: If has the value `true` the object will be collected.

showTotal.description: If has the value `true` the total will be showed.

showReference.description: If has the value true the order id  will be showed.

collectionRequired.description: If has the value `true` the object will be collected.
If has the value `true` the object will be collected.

customAmountAllowed.description: If has the value `true` the amount of the payment intent can be changed.

tipsAllowed.description: If has the value `true` tips are allowed.

PaymentIntentConfig.description: Details about the payment intent configurations.
PaymentIntentConfig.title: PaymentIntentConfig

title.description: The title of the payment intent.

redirectUrl.description: The URL where the customer will be directed to after the payment.

cancelUrl.description: The URL where the customer will be directed to when canceling the payment.

customerEmail.description: Configuration of the client's email address.

quantity.description: The quantity of items being purchased.

amountTotal.description: The total amount before applying discounts and taxes.

PaymentMethod.description: The payment methods that customers can use to pay.

ActionType.title: ActionType
ActionType.description: The type of action associated with the link.

ActionLink.title: ActionLink
ActionLink.description: The link to the payment's associated actions.

label.description: Custom label given to the action.

AutoExpireAction.description:
The action that happens with this payment intent after the date set in the `autoExpireAt`parameter.
Only avalible if `captureMode: Manual`.

captureMode.description: The type of capture for the payment.

amount.description: The amount intended to be collected by this payment intent.

reference.description: Details of the reference for the payment.

billingAddress.description: The address where to send the invoice.

shippingDetails.description: The address where to send the order.

transactionSource.description: Information about the transaction source type.

config.description: Details about the payment intent configuration.

itemLines.description: The line items purchased by the customer.

taxLines.description: The taxes applied to the items.

paymentMethods.description: The payment methods that customers can use to pay.

actionLink.description: The link to the payment's associated actions.

manualAutoExpireAt.description:
The timestamp of the date when this payment intent will be captured or reversed, in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) UTC format.
Only avalible if `captureMode: Manual`.

paymentSource.description: Information about the payment source type.

metadata.description: A set of key-value pairs that you can use for storing additional information.

transactionDateTime.description: The date and time of the payment in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) UTC format.

expiryDate.description: The expiry month and year. Format: MM/YY.

PaymentIntentStatus.description: Current status of the payment intent.
PaymentIntentStatus.title: PaymentIntentStatus

id.description: Unique identifier for the payment intent.

transactionSource.description: Information about the transaction source type.

paymentMethods.description: The payment methods that customers can use to pay.

amount.description: The amount intended to be collected by this payment intent.

requestedAmount.description: The amount that was requested by this Payment intent.

totalAmount.description: The total amount after applying discounts and taxes.

billingAddress.description: The address where to send the invoice.

shippingDetails.description: The address where to send the order.

createdAt.description: The timestamp of the create date, in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) UTC format.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp of the update date, in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) UTC format.

reference.description: Details of the reference for the payment.

subtotalLineItems.description: The total amount after applying discounts and taxes.

itemLines.description: The line items purchased by the customer.

taxLines.description: The taxes applied to the items.

actionLink.description: The link to the payment's associated actions.

config.description: Details about the payment intent configuration.

The timestamp of the date when this payment intent will be captured or reversed, in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) UTC format.
Only avalible if `captureMode: Manual`.

paymentSource.description: Information about the payment source type.

metadata.description: A set of key-value pairs that you can use for storing additional information.

type.description: A URI reference [RFC 3986](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3986) that identifies the problem type.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the error.

detail.description: A human-readable message giving more details about the error. Not always present.

traceId.description: The unique identifier of the failing request.

amount.description: The amount to capture. You can capture the full amount or a partial amount.

Cursor.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to be returned in a single page.

before.description: A cursor for use in pagination for the previous page. `before` and `after` are mutually exclusive - only one of these may be used.

after.description: A cursor for use in pagination for the next page. `before` and `after` are mutually exclusive - only one of these may be used.

paymentSource.description: Information about the payment source type.

startDate.description: Date and time from which to search, in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) UTC format.

endDate.description: Date and time until which to search in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) UTC format.

cursor.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

before.description: A cursor for use in pagination for the previous page. `before` and `after` are mutually exclusive - only one of these may be used.

after.description: A cursor for use in pagination for the next page. `before` and `after` are mutually exclusive - only one of these may be used.

amount.description: The amount intended to be collected by this payment intent.

emails.description: The list of email addresses to which the receipt should be sent.

previousTransactionId.description: Unique identifier for the previous transaction.

paymentIntentId.description: Unique identifier for the payment intent.

createdAt.description: The timestamp of the created date, in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) UTC format.

isActive.description: The status of the secret. It can be activated or deactivated.

url.description: The URL of your webhook endpoint.

secrets.description: The list of subscription’s secrets, used to generate signatures.
